claim: Vaccination with a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines.
explanation: Header of an original research article titled "Recombinant or Standard-Dose Influenza Vaccine in Adults under 65 Years of Age" with author names listed, no data or figures visible. The image does not support the claim as it only displays the article title and authors without any data on antibody responses to recombinant versus egg-based vaccines. Note: Only the title page is visible; no study results or figures are shown.
